actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend title 31, United States Code, to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to converting to contractor performance certain functions performed by such employees, and to amend the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 to provide for judicial review of certain agency decisions relating to converting to contractor performance of commercial activities performed by the Federal Government employees.
short_title: Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1989

summary.text: Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1989 - Amends Federal law on the procurement protest system to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Government employees relating to conversion to contractor performance of certain functions they perform. Amends the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 to provide for judicial review of certain agency decisions relating to conversion.

titles.title: Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1989

A bill to amend title 31, United States Code, to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to converting to contractor performance certain functions performed by such employees, and to amend the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 to provide for judicial review of certain agency decisions relating to converting to contractor performance of commercial activities performed by the Federal Government employees.
